title: Paderewski playing his Minuet followed by Beethoven's Moonlight Sonata
brief_description: The famous pianist, Paderewski, plays Beethoven’s Nocturne in C sharp minor, Opus 27 (better known as the “Moonlight Sonata”), and his own composition, Paderewski’s Minuet in G. Contains interesting footage of the audience and the wonderful “art deco” venue.
